He de añadir que muchos de los DLC se puede conseguir jugando a costa de invertir una buena cantidad de tiempo, sin embargo el juego aun sin estos DLC tiene un buen contenido base para disfrutar las horas que estime uno. Sin dudas un online must have.

Il gioco è davvero carino perchè la sua semplicità si traduce nell'essere giocato ovunque, sul letto da divano ecc., grazie anche allo steam controller (uno dei pochi giochi  dove lo steam controller ha senso). è un ottimo passatempo senza richiedere grosse abilità di giocatore. Il punto è che dopo un anno con l'ultimo aggiornamento  è ritornato il bug più fastidioso di quando era appena uscito e cioè che quando decidi di entrare in una lobby si blocca sul caricamento e anche riavviando il gioco per diverse volte il problema persiste. RISOLVETELO SUBITO perchè sono stufo di perdere le ore per fare 20 minuti di partita.

I have played this game only a little, though I intend to start getting into it soon, as I want to do some gameplay on my YT channel. But I have watched hundreds of hours of gameplay from both survivors and killers, and I want to share the insight I've gathered so far, as well as somewhat review this game.

[h1]Killers[/h1]
Some of the killers are much stronger than others, and though there are items/skills that can improve each killer, there is still a gap in capabilities for many killers. That is something that should be looked into by the devs, but at this point, balancing the game is practically impossible. Part of the reason is that players need to play each killer differently, and many of them don't. So, often, there will be a lot of voices clamoring over how weak a certain killer is. That killer could, indeed, be weaker, like the Trapper is often considered, or that killer could be great in the hands of a skilled player otherwise they feel really weak, like the Nurse. The issue is that people need to accept the strengths and weaknesses of the killers, and learn to play around them.

Still, there's still balance to be had. There are some items (for instance, Frank's Mixtape for Legion) that make some killers far too strong. Those items should, and likely will be fixed. People who play killers using those items will still happen, because some people are just afraid of challenge. The devs should be more on top of things like that, but so far haven't been, and that's a ding against them.

[h1]Survivors[/h1]
Playing survivor can be hard, especially if you don't know what it's like to be the killer. I'd suggest for everyone to play both sides to get a feel for what to expect. There are a lot of people out there who complain about things like scratchmarks and sounds giving them away, but those people are bad at the game. This isn't to say that they can't/won't improve, but it is to say that a lot of people complain before they get better, and then they leave their complaints up, which makes it seem like killers are always so powerful.

Being a survivor takes skill, most of the time. You have to learn how each killers plays, you have to learn what your survivor's weaknesses and strengths are (and play to them), and you have to learn how to escape from killers. Just running away, throwing down pallets, and jumping through windows isn't enough.

I have seen many, many games where all the survivors escaped, and they weren't even in voice chat with each other. That brings me to one benefit the survivors can have that the killers don't, voice chat. If you're having problems playing solo and surviving, you can play with your friends and use something like discord to work together against the killer. That, alone, can break a lot of the abilities/skills that some killers use. For instance, if you're lying on the ground after the killer downed you ("slugged"), and the killer has a perk to make it so other survivors can't see where you are, you can simply tell your friends where you are.

A final note, expect to sometimes get focused on by killers. Some people aren't very good at this game yet, and the only way they know how to kill survivors is to tunnel (vision) one survivor and camp them on the hook. If that happens to you, let it be. Once you're dead, you can move on to another game.

[h1]The Community[/h1]
And so, we come to the crux of the issue, the community. There are a lot of toxic players out there. Survivors will taunt you when you are the killer. Killers will tunnel and facecamp you when you're a survivor. If other people bother you when they are being jerks, then you should avoid this game. If, on the other hand, you want to get good enough to punish toxic players and rub the salt in their face afterwards, then play this game, get good at it, and dominate the trolls (who typically aren't that good). Of course, if you are a toxic person, you could also get this game, wind up not being good at it, complain on the forums about players who are better than you, teabag/taunt killers who aren't that good yet, and disconnect when a killer dominates you. You make the choice ;)

[h1]New Players[/h1]
That brings me to new players, as I'm about to be one myself. I've only played a few hours against friends way back when the game was in beta, but as I said, I've watched hundreds of hours of gameplay.

Keep multiple things in mind when you're starting off. You are bad at this game, and you're going to lose a lot. Some people will even go so far as to make fun of you. But stick with it. Watch videos and read guides on how to be a better killer/survivor. Play around with the different characters but settle on one that you want to get really good at, and learn the game with them. Don't let a few dingbats ruin your experience. Say "GG" after each game, or comment on how scary/good their build was, and move on if people are being toxic. Learn from the players who are better than you. If you're up against a killer who you can't escape from, look at how they are playing, and after the round, check out what skills/items they were using. Do the same with survivors that you just can't catch, or even survivors that performed better than you did.

Just remember, it's okay to start off being bad, but if you don't try to improve, why are you even wasting your time?

[h1]tl;dr[/h1]
The game is good, but beware of toxic players. Learn to play before getting frustrated, because you won't start out winning much, if at all. There's a difficulty curve, but once you've got it down, the real fun begins.
I need 240hz button in the game

"Pretty good job so far."

Ein an sich einzigartiges Spielprinzip, gepaart mit dem fast unendlichen Potential der Horrorwelt und der Motivation eines, größenteils in einem Ranked-Modus stattfindende,  Multiplayer-Spiels haben mich dazu gebracht mittlerweile vor einer etwas längeren Zeit in diesem Spiel zu versinken. 

Kein Multiplayer Game, außer MMos, hat es geschafft mich so lange bei sich halten zu können. 
So viele coole Killer und Survivor will man einfach perfektionieren, gerade wenn man ein Fan von z.B. der dazugehörigen Filmreihe ist, um sie so gut wie möglich ausspielen zu können. Gerade auch deshalb weil sich diese von der Spielweise nicht extrem stark von einander unterscheiden, diese Unterschiede allerdings extrem viel ausmachen können. 

Das Spiel macht von seiner Struktur insgesamt nicht viel unnötig kompliziert, was insgesamt eine große Stärke des Spiels ist, da man so viel konzentrierter verinnerlichen kann, wie man auf verschiedenste Spielweisen seiner Kontrahenten, oder Teamkameraden, reagieren muss. Allerdings kann nach einer gewissen Zeit, durch eben Genanntes, auch eine gewisse Langeweile entstehen.
Ich persönlich würde empfehlen kurze Pausen zwischen den Suchtphasen einzulegen ^^

Doch natürlich gibt es auch hier negative Punkte zunennen. DbD hat über seine eigene Community hinweg den Ruf eine extrem " toxische" Community zu haben. Diese trifften man auch des öfteren an, allerdings würde ich nicht behaupten das es sich dabei extrem stark von andren Multiplayer-Games unterscheidet. 
Ab und zu auftretende Bugs und das eher schlecht als Recht funktionierende Balancing-System werden auch mit dem zunehmenden Spielwissen der Konkurrenz zu immer größeren Problemen. 

Allerdings bleibt abschließend zu sagen, dass ich eine sehr lange Zeit, sowohl alleine als auch mit Freunden, sehr viel Spaß mit den Spiel hatte, und wahrscheinlich auch noch haben werde, und extrem gespannt bin in welche Richtung sich das Spiel in Zukunft entwickeln wird.

Неплохой для своего жанра хоррор.

Только если не учитывать токсичных Выживших, а так же Маньяков, которые фейскемперят или туннелят.
Ну, в каждой онлайн-игре есть такие люди, что ж поделать.

Если хотите поджечь свою жопку и/или поорать на своих тиммейтов (которые вас не услышат из-за особенностей игры), то DBD - это для вас.

Так же радуют обновления. Разработчики прислушываются к мнению геймеров и исправляют недочеты, ХОТЯ баги все еще есть, к ним нужно быть готовым.

Читеры тут тоже есть, однако встретить их можно редко.
Есть те, кто использует лагсвитч (подрубание торрентов), отсюда и телепорты через полкарты, и невозможность пройти проверку, и охреневание от наглости Маньяка.

Do yourself a favor. Start with Nurse, Hillbilly, or Huntress. Those are the only viable end game killers. I started blind and mained Wraith because I liked his power and the way he looked. Do not do this. You're not going to "break the mold" and successfully main a killer other than the three mentioned and make it to top rank. Survivors will run circles around you, teabag, and just make you hate this game.

Otherwise it's awesome, but the killers have major balance issues and for some reason no one even cares to fix them. Also, a practice area would be awesome to get used to shit before you dive into a game with a new killer. The three mentioned killers take some practice to master them. 

Also, don't stick around for the end-of-the-round chat, survivors will rarely have anything nice to say to you.

The matchmaking is awful and the balance feels unfair quite often. What's more, the Devs couldn't give less of a shit about this.

The game is fun. The concept is good. The thrills are there. Hiding in a locker, barely scraping past the killer, giving him the slip, saving your friend from certain death, and finally escaping. Or on the other hand, catching that sneaky bastard, leading someone into a trap, cornering them, and truly outwitting them. A great experience...... were the few games I played with people the same level as me.

If you're willing to get your shit smacked in until you become decent at the game, go ahead, this game is fun.
I just can't anymore. Getting matched against people who are just too much better at the game than you, seeing them taunt you as you struggle to figure out what you're doing wrong, getting teabagged at the exit, stalled out until they get bored of laughing at you, or my personal favourite, left behind, because it would've been slightly inconvenient to help someone new.

The game is good, the expereince is not.

tldr; new players need to sit through many hours of ass r#pe until they can enjoy the game.

Не покупайте ЭТО!
В целом игра не плохая. НО, нет баланса карт, убийц, так же не радует баланс на выживших. При начале игры уже сливается один, или даже двоя. И без DLC, играть нет смысла. Так же баги, много багов... Даже если вы запустили четыре гениратора без потерь, пятый будет для вас испытанием, так как разработчики решили что будет честно поставить  оставшиеся генераторы в радиусе 20-30 метров друг от друга, что для убицы пройти этот промежуток составит около 5-8 сек. это делает игру дисбалансной. Так же убицы слишком имбовые при силовых ударах они не замедляются и несутся быстрее вас, так что убежать от них практически нет шансов. Спрятатся в игре получается очень редко, есть очень яркие карты, где посути нету света, но освещение там, будто стоят прожектора. 
Вывод: НЕ ПОКУПАЙТЕ ЭТО ГОВНИЩЕ!
